lead_paragraph: An Oregon officer was barred from taking another police job after a charge involving a child. Three months later, he was a police chief in Kansas. Experts say it’s a widespread problem.

headline.print_headline: Officers With Troubled Pasts Often Wind Up Back in Blue
headline.main: Cast-Out Police Officers Are Often Hired in Other Cities

snippet: An Oregon officer was barred from taking another police job after a charge involving a child. Three months later, he was a police chief in Kansas. Experts say it’s a widespread problem....
abstract: Experts say thousands of problem police officers who have been fired, convicted of crimes or disbarred from policing nonetheless have been able to find police work elsewhere; lack of comprehensive national system for tracking such officers allows them to drift from department to department, and often to commit similar offenses; issue of how best to weed out such officers has been central to police shootings of black men.
